question: NBA: Will the Raptors beat the Grizzlies by more than 4.5 points in their November 30th matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for November 30th:

If the Toronto Raptors win by over 4.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

If the Memphis Grizzlies lose by less than 4.5 points or win, the market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by December 7th, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will the 7-day average of COVID cases on December 17th be higher than the 7-day average of COVID cases on December 10th?
description:
This is a market on whether the United States will report a 7-day average of COVID-19 cases for the date of December 17th that is higher than the 7-day average of COVID-19 cases reported for the date of December 10th. This market will resolve on data from the CDC's Data Tracker, specifically, the 7-day moving average of COVID-19 cases for the United States, which is available at https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#trends_dailytrendscases (navigate to "Select a state or territory" and select “United States”, and then scroll to "Data Table for Daily Case Trends" and view the data in the "7-Day Moving Avg" column, which is able to be sorted in descending order). 

The resolution source will be reviewed at 8 PM ET on December 24th to check the 7-day average for both the dates of December 17th and December 10th.  

If the 7-day average for December 17th exceeds that of December 10th at this check, "Yes" will win.  
Otherwise, "No" will win.  

If the resolution source is unavailable at that time, the resolution source will be checked again at 8pm the following and each subsequent day until it is available.

question: Will Joe Biden's disapproval rating be 51.5% or higher on December 12th?
description:
This is a market on whether Joe Biden's disapproval rating will be 51.5% or higher for the day of December 12, 2021. 

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's approval rating poll aggregator, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-approval-rating/, specifically the disapproval rating indicated by the orange trend line for the date of December 12, 2021. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates the (dis)approval rating will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. 

The resolution date for this market will be on December 13, 2021 at 12:00 PM ET according to data published for the day of December 12. If for any reason the resolution data is unavailable, the resolution source will be checked every 24 hours until the actual data is available. If the actual data is not available on the resolution source by December 19, 2021, 12:00 PM ET, this market will resolve to 50/50. 

If Joe Biden is not President on the resolution date, this market will resolve according to the most recent available approval rating.

question: Will Hikaru Nakamura win the 2021 Speed Chess Championship Main Event?
description:
The 2021 Speed Chess Championship is a multi-event series featuring top players competing in fast-paced games for a piece of the $232,000 prize fund. The event started on March 31 with the Bullet Chess Championship, followed by the Junior Speed Chess Championship, Grand Prix, Super Swiss, and ending with the Main Event on December 19.

The Main Event of the 2021 Speed Chess Championship unites 12 invited players with four others who qualified from the other events. The main event starts on November 12 and ends on December 19.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Hikaru Nakamura places 1st and is the winner of the 2021 SCC Main Event. 

If he finishes in any lower place, drops out of the tournament or the tournament is cancelled, this market will resolve to "No".

If, for any reason, the tournament is not completed and the winner is not announced by January 1, 2022, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will inflation be 0.8% or more from October to November 2021?
description:
This is a market on a month-to-month inflation, as measured by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (CPI-U), from October to November 2021.

The inflation is measured by a change in Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) on a seasonally adjusted basis, reported by U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the index increased by 0.8 percent or more (i.e. eighty-hundredths of 1%) from October 2021 to November 2021 and "No" otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be the BLS November 2021 Consumer Price Index report (https://www.bls.gov/bls/news-release/cpi.htm), currently scheduled for release on December 10, 2021, 8:30 AM ET. Resolution of this market will take place upon release of the aforementioned data. 

-------------------------
The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a measure of the average change over time in the prices paid by urban consumers for a market basket of consumer goods and services.

Note that the resolution source for this market will be the official monthly BLS CPI news release which reports seasonally-adjusted month-to-month inflation to only one decimal point (e.g. 0.6%, 0.5%, etc). Thus, this is the level of precision that will be used when resolving the market (e.g. if seasonally adjusted month-to-month CPI-U is 0.7%, the market will resolve to “No”, if it is 0.8%, this market will resolve to “Yes”).
